fields.description:
*User Story*

As the LogixPanel team,

We want to conduct QA testing for calculate logics for Individual Accounts

So that we can ensure the calculations are working as required.





*Acceptance Criteria*

# For Individual Accounts:
## Complete live account application form
### One account for LTD
### One account for AU
## Cross-reference the values of LogixCRM → Leads and LogixPanel Admin Portal → Individual Accounts 
## Check the logics of the following categories/sections:
### Overall risk rating (already in LogixPanel)
### Nationality
#### {color:#ff5630}Currently still working on sync from CRM to LP in story: {color}[https://zerologix.atlassian.net/browse/LP1-3837|https://zerologix.atlassian.net/browse/LP1-3837|smart-link]{color:#ff5630}){color}
#### ONLY need to test the field from LogixPanel by updating ‘Nationality’ value in Individual trader’s profile page.
### Country of residency (already in LogixPanel)
### Industry
#### {color:#ff5630}Currently still working on sync from CRM to LP in story: {color}[https://zerologix.atlassian.net/browse/LP1-3837|https://zerologix.atlassian.net/browse/LP1-3837|smart-link]{color:#ff5630}){color}
#### ONLY need to test the field from LogixPanel by updating ‘Industry’ value in Individual trader’s profile page.
### Employment status (already in LogixPanel)
### Product Risk (already in LogixPanel)
### Delivery Channel Risk
#### {color:#ff5630}Currently still working on sync from CRM to LP in story: (logics is based on when client has completed the form) in story: {color}[https://zerologix.atlassian.net/browse/LP1-3837|https://zerologix.atlassian.net/browse/LP1-3837|smart-link]{color:#ff5630}){color}
#### {color:#ff5630}This is default, cannot be updated.{color}
## Check the changes on risk column and kyc risk score section in individual trader’s profile page are in accordance with kyc risk score calculation.

fields.summary: [Part 1: Research] Checking MT4/MT5 Account Status for Deposits, Withdrawals and Internal Transfers in LogixPanel

issuetype.description: Functionality or a feature expressed as a user goal.
issuetype.name: Story

status.description: This issue is being actively worked on at the moment by the assignee.
status.name: In Progress

fields.description:
*User Story*

As a system,

I want to implement new logics for checking and verifying MT4/MT5 Account Status for Deposits, Withdrawals and Internal Transfers in LogixPanel

So that I do not rely and wait for Thrift’s response. 



*Background*

Follow up story to [https://zerologix.atlassian.net/browse/LP1-2904|https://zerologix.atlassian.net/browse/LP1-2904|smart-link].

----

*Report by* [~accountid:6191bb4debce47006794773d] and [~accountid:61d4f155326554006c015f63]:

*Findings*

The current Internal Transfer workflow works under normal circumstances:

Step 1. LP sends cmd to Thrift to withdraw from Source Account.
Step 2. Wait for Thrift to respond- Successful, Failed, Timeout.
Step 3. If successful, issue cmd to Thrift to deposit into Destination Account.
Step 4. Wait for Thrift to respond- Successful, Failed, Timeout.
{color:#ff5630}Step 5. {color}If successful, do nothing; If Failed or Timeout, issue command to Thrift to deposit into Source Account.

 

The scenario that we observed for the current issue is that, at {color:#ff5630}Step 5{color},  LogixPanel kept receiving Timeout from Thrift, although the deposit to Destination Account was actually successful.

And since Timeout is treated as Failed, LogixPanel issues the command to Thrift to deposit into Source Account.

 

*Further findings*

Our current Withdraw and Deposit workflow only check Thrift's response, it does not verify the status of MT4 or MT5 account.

With the current logic workflow, it is likely to happen again if the Thrift timeouts at {color:#ff5630}Step 5{color} in the future.

----





*Acceptance Criteria*

* Proposed long-term solution by [~accountid:6191bb4debce47006794773d] and [~accountid:61d4f155326554006c015f63]:
** Immediately after every Withdraw and Deposit, add a checking to verify MT4 and MT5 account status; so that we don't only rely on Thrift's response.
** The logic implementation should cover the following conditions:
*** The combination of Source Account and Destination Account can be either MT4 or MT5 account.
*** The method to check MT4 and MT5 account status differs.
*** The check of MT4 account status is via TCP socket connection.
*** The check of MT5 account status is via Web API.
* Research solutions.
* Conduct testing for the following internal transfers:
** MT4 to MT4
** MT4 to MT5
** MT5 to MT5
** MT5 to MT4
fields.summary: [Part 2: Testing & Implementation] Checking MT4/MT5 Account Status for Deposits, Withdrawals and Internal Transfers in LogixPanel
[Backend] Conduct testing for the scenarios of internal transfers

## Delivery Channel (logic should be based on when the client complete the form and passed to CRM)
!564645.png|width=1920,height=967!

## Complete form, which has passed to CRM.
## CRM data has passed LogixPanel.



{color:#ff5630}*Note: No QA needed for this story.*{color}

comments.body: [Lincoln Liao|https://gitlab.com/Lincoln0411] mentioned this issue in [a merge request|https://gitlab.com/zerologix/logixpanel/cloudhub/-/merge_requests/2150] of [Zerologix / LogixPanel / cloudhub|https://gitlab.com/zerologix/logixpanel/cloudhub] on branch [LP1-3733|https://gitlab.com/zerologix/logixpanel/cloudhub/-/tree/LP1-3733]:{quote}<LP1-3733> Create calculate single individual account API{quote}

[Lincoln Liao|https://gitlab.com/Lincoln0411] mentioned this issue in [a merge request|https://gitlab.com/zerologix/logixpanel/api_cloudhub/-/merge_requests/239] of [Zerologix / LogixPanel / api_cloudhub|https://gitlab.com/zerologix/logixpanel/api_cloudhub] on branch [LP1-3733|https://gitlab.com/zerologix/logixpanel/api_cloudhub/-/tree/LP1-3733]:{quote}<LP1-3733> Connect calculate risk score API{quote}

Hello [~accountid:62257aee94f7e20069003aa9] this feature was already merged into the master and could be tested in the testing environment, I’ve tested it in the testing environment and it looks fine, would you please help to test it?

[Fung Cheung|https://gitlab.com/fungcheung1128] mentioned this issue in [a merge request|https://gitlab.com/zerologix/logixpanel/cloudhub/-/merge_requests/2157] of [Zerologix / LogixPanel / cloudhub|https://gitlab.com/zerologix/logixpanel/cloudhub] on branch [LP1-3733|https://gitlab.com/zerologix/logixpanel/cloudhub/-/tree/LP1-3733]:{quote}<LP1-3733> Bugfix{quote}

The test execution for LTD env has been done with {color:#36b37e}*PASSED*{color} results, the AU env testing will be delayed because currently there’s no form in testing env is connected to AU env. .
While conducting the test, there’s a change requirement be found.

In the KYC Score Setting, there is “Prohibited“ risk score for each field which with NA as the assigned score. However, since the risk score setting of prohibited value is NA, the calculation of the final risk will take the corresponding field as 0. Which means in some cases, even the client application with prohibited value, the total risk after calculation might be “Low“.

!image-20230206-092538.png|width=2464,height=1029!

This issue has already been brought up to[~accountid:62cb7541afe495359d9d07c5], the compliance team would like to change the final value  into “Prohibited” if there’s any prohibited value in the client application . Currently it’s waiting for further instruction.



FYI [~accountid:6383fac18fd2d2d5f12f272c] [~accountid:62538eb7cdc240007049cc33]

fields.description:
As an admin I want to calculate risk score for corporate accounts manually

*Design:*

[https://www.figma.com/file/AuxMEaiE9UJRRPc3vWIRsj/Risk-Setting?node-id=261%3A2536&t=oqth4WGjxgRX6zE9-0|https://www.figma.com/file/AuxMEaiE9UJRRPc3vWIRsj/Risk-Setting?node-id=261%3A2536&t=oqth4WGjxgRX6zE9-0]

*Acceptance Criteria:*

# In LogixPanel Admin Portal ACY LTD and AU → Clients → Corporate Accounts:
!Individual account (1).png|width=50%!
## Add *Risk column* to corporate accounts. Value is high/low/medium/seek approval basis the risk score of customized field
## Clicking corportate accounts should have risk score calculation details (*refer to AC 2 below*)
# In corporate trader’s profile page, add a section labelled, ‘*KYC Risk Score*’, which should contain a table of the following:

* KYC risk score table can be edited
* Text field by name ‘Comments’ which allows compliance team to manually add the comments 
* Text field to manually assign risk score 
* Risk rank dropdown list(High, Medium, Low, Seek approval)
* Selected risk rank becomes value of corporate accounts *‘Risk’* Column
* !image-20230111-073854.png|width=1323,height=214!

3. Default is blank

4.Language: English/Chinese

5. Font color: Seek Approval color

issuetype.description: Functionality or a feature expressed as a user goal.
issuetype.name: Story

fields.description:
*User Story:*

As an admin I want to add column ‘Risk’

So that compliance team can know the risk level of all individual accounts





*Design*:

[https://www.figma.com/file/AuxMEaiE9UJRRPc3vWIRsj/Risk-Setting?node-id=21%3A1449&t=pvn33H1phGbC8yuC-1|https://www.figma.com/file/AuxMEaiE9UJRRPc3vWIRsj/Risk-Setting?node-id=21%3A1449&t=pvn33H1phGbC8yuC-1]

!45345345hdfgedrg.PNG|width=560,height=527!



*Acceptance Criteria:*

# In LogixPanel Admin Portal ACY LTD and AU → Clients → Individual Accounts:
!Individual account (1).png|width=1440,height=924!
## Add *Risk column* to individual accounts. Value is high/low/medium/seek approval basis the total of individual risk score of all CRA fields
## Clicking individual accounts should have risk score calculation details (*refer to AC 2 below*)
# In individual trader’s profile page, add a section labelled, ‘*KYC Risk Score*’, which should contain a table of the following:
# !image-20221229-052253.png|width=865,height=583!
## Value of ‘Country of Residency’ is value of Country field from application
## Value of ‘Nationality’ is value of nationality field from application
## Value of ‘Industry’ is value of Industry field from application
## Value of ‘Employment’ is value of Employment field from application
## ‘Product Risk’ has defined preset value
## ‘Delivery Channel Risk’ is online hence score is 10
## Result is total of all five rows and risk rank is derived from overall risk rating table



{color:#ff5630}*Note:* {color}{color:#ff5630}QA does not need to conduct testing of calculate in this sprint. It will be in separate story.{color}
